comment.author: 22563422@N03
comment._content:
The bottom one is really a "Portuguese Long Distance Machine", and what a find this photo is!
This is a Breguet 16 Bn-2 that left Lisbon on 7 April 1924 to make the first Lisbon-Macau flight. "Patria", or has it has been recorded in history as "Patria I" crash landed in India. The travel was completed on a DH9 locally bought, and named "Patria II". This is the best picture of "Patria" that I am aware of! Thank you, San Diego Air and Space Museum!

comment.author: 74784995@N00
comment._content: The top aircraft looks like the successful? De Pinedo flight in a SIAI (Savoia S16ter) to Australia en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SIAI_S.16 and the lower Portuguese Breguet 16 PATRIA is on the ex-OGMA page ex-ogma.blogspot.co.uk/2009/03/avioes-da-am-breguet-br16-... which has a map
